title.rendered: Canada Express Entry Latest Draw October 2022

content.rendered:
[vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” top_padding_phone=”15%” bottom_padding_phone=”15%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-5-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”7/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”]
Share Tweet Share Pin
[vc_column_text]On October 12, 2022, the Express Entry Latest Draw results for round #233 were announced by IRCC. It was an all-program draw in which 4,250 invitations were issued to the Express Entry candidates. The number of invitations increased by 500 since the last draw. The CRS cut-off score for this draw was 500 and has been reduced by 4 points.

The latest Express Entry Draw included all three federal categories including Federal Skilled Worker (FSW), Canadian Experience Class (CEC), and Federal Skilled Trades (FST).  A total of 238,273 Express Entry Profiles are in the pool as of October 12, 2022.

The Latest Canada Express Entry Draw Results:

  • Express Entry Round: #233
  • Draw Date: October 12, 2022
  • CRS Cut-off Score: 500
  • No. of invitations: 4,250
  • Tie-breaking rule: October 12, 2022

width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” offset=”vc_hidden-lg vc_hidden-md vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][vc_custom_heading text=”The Next Express Entry Draw Prediction: October 26, 2022″ use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665596975884{padding-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]The Next Express Entry Draw will be held on October 26, 2022. The CRS score has finally come below the 500 range, which is great news for many Express Entry candidates.

In order to predict the future Express Entry Draw, we need an important metric, that is the number of candidates added to the pool between September 28, 2022, and October 12, 2022.

As there is no way to predict it exactly, let’s take the average number of candidates added to the pool in the last three draws. In today’s Express Entry Latest Draw, a total of 4,250 invitations were issued, out of which 466 straight away went to the 601-Above CRS range. The rest of the 2,784 invitations were issued to the 501-600 range.

Please refer to the table below for the average no. of Candidates to be added before the Next Express Entry Draw.[/vc_column_text][image_with_animation image_url=”10895″ animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][image_with_animation image_url=”10896″ animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default” margin_top=”5%” margin_bottom=”5%”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1663191085840{margin-top: 30px !important;}”]Just like this draw, in the Next Express Entry draw only candidates within 601 and above and 501-600 CRS ranges will receive invitations.

For the 501-600 range, there is a big difference between 7,431 (before the draw) and 4,152 (after the draw), the cut-off score for the Next Express Entry Draw will be around 501-511.

This is a broad range, and we need to narrow it down. If we assume numeric distribution between 501 and 511, which means all candidates are evenly spread out and there is no skew.

So, 7,431 candidates are evenly among 10 points (501-511). Sending out 3,279 invitations will cover (3279/7431)*10 which equals 4 points. So the next cut-off score may come down 4 points bringing it to 507.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Apply for Express Entry?” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”none” text=”Book a Consultation” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/” margin_top=”20px” css_animation=”fadeInUp”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”How to increase your CRS Score?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1663182067584{margin-top: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]If you have a CRS Score ranging from 450-470 you can increase it using the following ways:

1. Obtain a valid full-time job offer

If you believe you have the qualifications and experience necessary to get a job offer from a Canadian business, this could improve your CRS score. Your final CRS Score will increase by up to 200 points if you receive a job offer from a Canadian employer. Though receiving a job offer is not simple, it is possible.

This might be useful: How to get a job offer from outside Canada?

2. Study Permit to PR Pathway

One of the simplest methods to address the Low CRS issue is the Study Permit to PR pathway. This lets you acquire relevant experience to apply for Express Entry inside Canada. There are many applicants who are older than 35, 40, and 50, they do not believe that a study permit is an ideal option for them. These applicants can reach out to us, as we specialize in these types of cases.

Read more: Canada Study Visa After 5 to 25 Years Gap

3. Visitor Visa to Work Permit

While in Canada on a visiting visa, you can apply for jobs as well. If you wish to submit an Express Entry application, a work visa must be issued by a Canadian employer. With the aid of your friends, family, or other contacts, you can get employment in Canada.

Learn more: Visitor Visa to Work Permit in Canada

4. Go for Provincial Nominee Programs

Provincial Nominee Programs assist those who want to relocate to a particular Canadian province. The PNPs can be aligned with Express Entry, and you can receive up to 600 points, which will undoubtedly increase your CRS score above the threshold.

You may also like: PNP vs. Express Entry: Which is better for you?

5. French Language

Any level of French proficiency can benefit you to gain more CRS points for Canada. Your proficiency in French can boost your CRS score by up to 50 points, which will help you cross the cut-off score.

6. Bill C-19

Many applicants will be able to receive an invitation as a result of the enactment of Bill C-19, which is very soon will be in effect. In other words, you should wait for occupation-specific draws in which cut-off scores with not matter, and you may get an invitation even if your CRS Score is low.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner can get the right guidance from Team COLOSSUS’s skilled immigration consultants as you go through the Express Entry procedure. Mr. Keshav Sharma, the team’s leader, is a Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC) with vast knowledge in the immigration field. Let’s work together to realize your dream of living in Canada.

excerpt.rendered: IRCC invited a total of 4,250 candidates in the Canada Express Entry Latest Draw held on October 12, 2022. The latest cut-off score was 500.
